thread.title: Soul man Allen Stone keeps it real
thread.title_full: Soul man Allen Stone keeps it real - SFGate

author: sfgate.com
title: Soul man Allen Stone keeps it real
text:
Allen Stone has drawn comparisons to soul greats like Donny Hathaway and Marvin Gaye , but the Seattle singer is not out to reappropriate the past. With his long blond locks, thick glasses and off-key singing, he wouldn’t fit the part anyway.
Earlier this year, Stone released his third album and major label debut, “Radius,” which sees him doubling up on keeping it real — part of the reason he travels with an eight-piece live band, refusing to use recorded backing tracks on tour.
“And good God, I would be fat and happy, and have way more money in my bank account if I did,” he said. “And my band, when I can afford it, has two horn players out with it as well. All those people are human beings with stomachs to feed and rent to pay. They cost a lot more than a MacBook Pro.”
— Aidin Vaziri 
Allen Stone: 8 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22. $27.50. Fox Theater , 1807 Telegraph Ave., Oakland. www.ticketmaster.com.
